title: Number of Days in a Month

content.content:
SEE HERE - Bad Question. This is what it should mention:

This factors into account, leap years. Common knowledge is that this occurs every 4 years making February have 29 days rather than 28 days.

What is not common knowledge is that it is not considered a leap year if it is divisible by 100.
Ex: 1900 and 1800

However, if it's divisible by 400, then it IS a leap year.
Ex: 2000 and 1600

This question relies on obscure knowledge and outside sources.
Refer here for where I found this info that led me to a passing result:

https://nrc.canada.ca/en/certifications-evaluations-standards/canadas-official-time/what-years-are-leap-years
